title: Entering/Leaving a Rock Concert part - b

content.description: The rate at which people enter an auditorium for a rock concert is modeled by the function R given by \(R(t)=1380t^2-675t^3\) for \(0\le t\le2\) hours; R(t) is measured in people per hour. No one is in the auditorium at time t = 0, when the doors open. The doors close and the concert begins at time t = 2.
content.question: Find the time when the rate at which people enter the auditorium is a maximum. Justify your answer.

frqParts.text: Find the time when the rate at which people enter the auditorium is a maximum. Justify your answer.

topic.text: 4.3: Rates of Change in Applied Contexts Other Than Motion

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
